intro: Racosperma lamprocarpum, commonly known as the glossy fruit racosperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, glossy, elongated fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
